title: Quiz 1 - Time and Work
instruction:
Directions (46-50): The table below shows the data regarding the minutes taken by five friends to complete different games playing alone and together on different days of a week.

Game

Name

Day

Shubham

Vishal

Sandeep

Prashant

Ali

All together

COC

Monday

20

30

12

 

6

NFS HP

Tuesday

—

30

15

20

6

3

Candy C

Wednesday

45

30

 

—

9

40

30

quiz.text: 18 boys can do a piece of work in 24 days. In how many days can 27 boys do the same work?
options: 16
32
23
48
None of these

quiz.text: How many days will 1648 persons take to construct a dam, if 721 persons can build the same in 48 days?
options: 21 days
20 days
23 days
24 days
None of these

quiz.text: If 10 persons can do a job in 20 days, then 20 persons with twice the efficiency can do the same job in :
options: 5 days
10 days
20 days
40 days
None of these

quiz.text: A and B can separately do a piece of work in 6 days and 12 days respectively. How long will they together take to do the work?
options: 9 days
18 days
6 days
4 days
None of these

quiz.text: A job can be completed by 12 men in 12 days. How many extra days will be needed to complete the job if, 6 men leave after working for 6 days?
options: 3
6
12
24
None of these

quiz.text: A and B can do a piece of work in 12 days and 15 days, respectively. They began to work together but A left after 4 days. In how many more days would B alone complete the remaining work?
options: 20/3
25/3
6
5
None of these

quiz.text: Working efficiencies of A and B for completing a piece of work are in the ratio 3: 4. The number of days to be taken by them to complete the work will be in the ratio.
options: 3 : 2
2 : 3
3 : 4
4 : 3
None of these

quiz.text: 5 men can prepare 10 toys in 6 days working 6 hours a day. Then in how many days can 12 men prepare 16 toys working 8 hrs a day?
options: 5 days
3 days
4 days
6 days
None of these

quiz.text: If A and B together can complete a work in 18 days. A and C together in 12 days, and B and C together in 9 days, then B alone can do a work in
options: 18 days
24 days
30 days
40 days
None of these

quiz.text: P, Q and R contract a work for Rs. 550. Together, P and Q are supposed to do 7/11 of the work. How much does R get?
options: Rs. 200
Rs. 300
Rs. 150
Rs. 250
None of these

quiz.text: P, Q and R undertake to do a work for Rs. 707. P and Q together do 5/7 of the work and rest is done by R alone. How much should R get?
options: Rs. 202
Rs. 200
Rs. 102
Rs. 150
None of these

quiz.text: A and B can complete a piece of work in 15 days and 10 days respectively. They contracted to complete the work for Rs. 30000. The share of A in the contracted money will be.
options: Rs. 18000
Rs. 16500
Rs. 12500
Rs. 12000
None of these

quiz.text: A daily-wage laborer was engaged for a certain number of days for Rs 5,750 but being absent on some days he was paid only Rs 5,000. What was his maximum possible daily wage?
options: Rs 125
Rs 250
Rs 375
Rs 500
None of these

quiz.text: A can finish a work in 24 days, B in 9 days, and C in 12 days. B and C start the work but are forced to leave after 3 days. The remaining work was done by A in:
options: 5 days
6 days
10 days
10.5 days
None of these

quiz.text: If 3 men or 6 women can do a piece of work in 16 days, in how many days can 12 men and 8 women do the same piece of work?
options: 4 days
5 days
3 days
2 days
None of these

quiz.text: A can do a work in 15 days and B in 20 days. If they together work on it for 4 days, then the fraction of the work that is left is:
options: 8/15
7/15
1/4
1/10
None of these

quiz.text: If a job is to be completed in 10 days, it requires 270 persons. If 180 persons take up the same job, they will finish it in.
options: 27 days
12 days
15 days
18 days
None of these

quiz.text: 4 mat-weavers can weave 4 mats in 4 days. At the same rate how many mats would be woven by 8 mat-weavers in 8 days?
options: 4
8
12
16
None of these

quiz.text: A and B can do a job in 6 and 12 days, respectively. They began the work together but A leaves after 3 days. Then, the total number of days needed for the completion of the work is
options: 4
5
6
9
None of these

quiz.text: A alone can complete a work in 18 days and B alone in 15 days. B alone worked at it for 10 days and then left the work. In how many more days, will A alone complete the remaining work?
options: 5
5(1/2)
6
8
None of these

quiz.text: How many men will be required to plough 100 acres of land in 10 days if 10 men require 8 days to plough 20 acres of land?
options: 30
40
60
50
None of these

quiz.text: A and B can do a piece of work in 20 days and 12 days, respectively. A started the work alone and then after 4 days, B joined him till the completion of the work. How long did the work last?
options: 10 days
20 days
15 days
6 days
None of these

quiz.text: A can do a piece of work in 12 days and B in 15 days. They worked together for 5 days and then B left. The days taken by A to finish the remaining work is
options: 3
5
10
12
None of these

quiz.text: A and B can do a work in 12 days. B and C can do the same work in 15 days, C and A can do the same work in 20 days. The time taken by A, B and C to do the same work is?
options: 5 days
10 days
15 days
20 days
None of these

quiz.text: 18 women can complete a work in 12 days and 12 men can complete the same work in 9 days. In how many days will 8 men and 8 women complete that work?
options: 9 days
6 days
12 days
8 days
None of these

quiz.text: A and B can do a piece of work in 12 days, B and C in 8 days, and C and A in 6 days. How long would B take to do the same work alone?
options: 24 days
32 days
40 days
48 days
None of these

quiz.text: A group of men decided to do a work in 10 days, but five of them absented themselves. If the rest of the group finished the work in 12 days, find the original of men?
options: 20 men
30 men
40 men
50 men
None of these

quiz.text: To complete a work. A takes 50% more time than B. If together they take 18 days to complete the work, how much time shall B take to do it?
options: 30 days
35 days
40 days
45 days
None of these

quiz.text: A completes a piece of work in 4 days and B completes it in 6 days. If they both work on it together, then the number of days required to complete the same work is
options: 2(2/5) days
3(2/5) days
3(5/2) days
2(5/2) days
None of these

quiz.text: A and B can do a piece of work in 18 days, B and C in 24 days, A and C in 36 days. In what time can they do it all working together?
options: 12 days
13 days
16 days
26 days
None of these

quiz.text: A and B can separately complete a piece of work in 20 days and 30 days respectively. They worked together for some time, then B left the work. If A completed the rest of the work in 10 days, then B worked for?
options: 6 days
8 days
12 days
16 days
None of these

quiz.text: A can do a work in 6 days and B can do the same work in 5 days. The contract for the work is of Rs. 220. How much shall B get if both of them work together?
options: Rs. 110
Rs. 120
Rs. 130
Rs. 150
None of these

quiz.text: P, Q and R undertake to do a work for Rs. 660. P and Q together do 8/11 of the work and rest is done by R alone. How much should R get?
options: Rs. 200
Rs. 160
Rs. 180
Rs. 190
None of these

quiz.text: A farmer can plough a field working 6 h per day in 18 days. The worker has to work how many hours per day to finish the same work in 12 days?
options: 7
9
11
13
None of these

quiz.text: A can do a job in 6 days and A and B can do it together in 2 days. How many days will be taken by B to do the job alone?
options: 5 days
3 days
4 days
8 days
None of these

quiz.text: P can complete a piece of work in 16 days which Q can complete in 32 days. P and Q work on alternate days. Quantity 1: Time taken by them to complete the work if P starts on day 1. Quantity 2: time taken by them to complete the work if Q starts on day 1.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
If 10 men and 15 women complete a piece of work in 8 days while 12 men and 8 women can complete the same piece of work in 10 days. If A boy who is 50% less efficient than the man, can do the same work in 50 days.

Quantity I : Time taken by 2 men, 4 women and 18 boys to complete the work.

Quantity II : Time taken by 9 men, 3 women and 6 boys to complete the same work.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text: Quantity 1: Time taken by Manoj and Shubham to complete the work together. When Manoj works alone, he takes 4.8 hrs more than the time taken by Manoj and Shubham to complete the work together. When Shubham works alone, he takes 10.8 hrs more than the time taken by both of them to complete the work together. Quantity 2: 7.4 hrs.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text: Quantity 1:Badri when works alone, takes 7.2 hrs more than the time taken by both Badri and Suresh to finish the work together. Suresh when works alone, takes 9.8 hrs more than the time taken by both Badri and Suresh to finish the work together. Time taken by both of them to complete the work working together. Quantity 2: 8.4 hrs.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Quantity I — Time is taken by A to complete work alone if A can complete a work in 5 more days than B while A does the same work in 9 more days than C. If A and B can complete the whole work at the same time as the time taken by C alone to do the whole work. 

Quantity II — Time is taken by 8 men and 14 women to reap of 360 hectares land by working 7 hrs per day while 6 men and 10 women can reap  part of the land in 15 days by working 6 hrs. per day. It is also given that the work of 2 men is equal to that of 3 women.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text: If Neeraj and Abhimanyu started working and after 2 days they were replaced by Charu, Anshul and Nipa and then they worked for 2 days together. How much work is still left?
options: 1/10
1/6
1/9
1/12
None of these

quiz.text: If all the boys work together then time taken by them will be how much less than the time taken by Swati, Mansi, Charu and Nipa together to do the work?
options: 2 days
2.1 days
2.2 days
2.3 days
None of these

quiz.text: Aniket and Gopal started working, Aniket worked at 120%. Of his efficiency and Gopal worked at 5/6 at his efficiency. They started working on alternate days starting with Aniket. How many days will be taken by them to complete the work?
options: None of these

quiz.text: How many days will it take to complete the work if saurabh does the 25% of the work alone, 10% is done by Gopal alone, the remaining work is done by Sonakshi and only one of them is working at a time?
options: 19 days
16 days
13 days
17days
None of these

quiz.text: Prashant started working alone but after 5 days of working he found that he has done only 25% work so to complete the remaining work on time he was expected to complete the work, by how much percentage he should increase his efficiency?
options: 52.5%
55%
50%
45%
None of these

quiz.text: If on Thursday, Sandeep is 40% less efficient than Prashant, then what is the time taken by all the friends to complete ‘Surf  sub’ playing together?
options: minutes
minutes
minutes
minutes
None of these

quiz.text: If the ratio of efficiencies of Sandeep and Prashant, on Wednesday, is 5 : 6, then calculate the time taken by Sandeep to Finish the game ‘Candy C’ playing alone ?
options: 12 minutes
18 minutes
15 minutes
20 minutes
None of these

quiz.text: The time taken by Prashant to complete ‘COC’ is what percent more/less than the time taken by Shubham & Vishal to finish the same game playing together ?
options: 20%
24%
25%
30%
None of these

quiz.text: On Friday, the ratio of efficiency of Vishal to that of Ali is 1 : 4 and Vishal and Ali together are 25% more efficient than Subham, Sandeep and Prashant together. What is the time taken by all of them to finish TTA playing together ?
options: minutes
minutes
minutes
minutes
None of these

quiz.text: For which game does Subham take minimum amount of time?
options: Bridge Town
COC
Surf Sub
NFS HP
Candy C
